content.content:
What is HTML?

HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating web pages. It defines the structure and content of a webpage using various elements represented by tags.

content.title: Key Point
content.content: HTML is the skeleton of every web page you see on the internet. It provides the structure that is then styled with CSS and made interactive with JavaScript.

Basic Structure of an HTML Document

Every HTML document follows a basic structure that includes doctype declaration, html, head, and body elements.

Hello, World!

This is my first webpage.

content.starterCode:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>My Page</title>
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Write your code here -->
    
</body>
</html>
content.solutionCode:
Welcome to my page

This is a paragraph of text.

content.question: Which tag is used to define the main content area of an HTML document?

feedback.correct: That's right! The <body> tag contains all the content that you want to show to web visitors, such as text, images, tables, forms, etc.
feedback.incorrect: Not quite. The <body> tag is the container for all visible content in an HTML document.

content.content:
HTML Elements

HTML elements are the building blocks of HTML pages. They are represented by tags, written using angle brackets.

HTML Tags

Most HTML elements have an opening tag and a closing tag, with content in between.

content.title: Key Point
content.content:
Some HTML elements are 'self-closing' and don't need a closing tag, such as ,
, and .

HTML Attributes

HTML attributes provide additional information about HTML elements and are always specified in the opening tag.

content.title: Match HTML Elements with Their Purpose

content.question: Which HTML attribute specifies an alternate text for an image if the image cannot be displayed?

feedback.correct: Correct! The alt attribute provides alternative information for an image if a user cannot view it (due to slow connection, error, or if the user uses a screen reader).
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. The alt attribute provides alternative text for an image if it cannot be displayed.

content.content:
What is CSS?

CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a stylesheet language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML. CSS describes how elements should be rendered on screen, on paper, in speech, or on other media.

content.title: Key Point
content.content: CSS is responsible for the visual aspects of web pages, while HTML handles the structure and content.

CSS Syntax

CSS consists of a selector and a declaration block. The selector points to the HTML element you want to style, and the declaration block contains one or more declarations separated by semicolons.

CSS Selectors

CSS selectors are used to "find" or select HTML elements based on their element name, id, class, attribute, and more.

pairs.match: Selects all p elements that are direct children of a div element

content.question: Which of the following is the correct CSS syntax?

feedback.correct: Correct! The proper CSS syntax includes the selector followed by curly braces containing property:value pairs.
feedback.incorrect: Not quite. The proper CSS syntax is: selector {property: value;}
